intro: Centrostachys grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered centrostachys, is a species of flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators including bees and butterflies. The leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
